intro: Ctenitis mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican ctenitis, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its distinctive fronds with a serrated margin. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its rhizome is thick and fleshy, supporting the growth of its delicate, bipinnate leaves. Ctenitis mexicana plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
